009package com.weather.sdk.model;
010
011import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonCreator;
012import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonIgnoreProperties;
013import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonProperty;
014import java.util.List;
015import java.util.Objects;
016
017/**
018 * Immutable data transfer object representing the complete weather information for a location.
019 *
020 * <p>This class encapsulates all weather-related data returned from the OpenWeatherAPI and provides
021 * a type-safe, immutable representation of the weather response.
022 *
023 * <p><strong>Immutability:</strong> All fields are final and instances are immutable. Thread-safe
024 * for concurrent access from multiple threads.
025 *
026 * <h2>Weather Data Structure</h2>
027 *
028 * <p>The weather data follows the OpenWeatherAPI response format and includes:
029 *
030 * <ul>
031 *   <li>Current weather conditions (main description, detailed description)
032 *   <li>Temperature data (current temperature, feels-like temperature)
033 *   <li>Visibility information (in meters)
034 *   <li>Wind data (speed and direction)
035 *   <li>System information (sunrise, sunset times)
036 *   <li>Location metadata (timezone offset, city name)
037 *   <li>Data timestamp
038 * </ul>
039 *
040 * <h2>JSON Mapping</h2>
041 *
042 * <p>This class is designed to be automatically mapped from OpenWeatherAPI JSON responses using
043 * Jackson ObjectMapper. All fields use appropriate Jackson annotations for proper deserialization.
044 *
045 * <h2>Jackson Annotations</h2>
046 *
047 * <ul>
048 *   <li>Maps to OpenWeatherAPI JSON response fields
049 *   <li>Ignores unknown properties to handle API changes gracefully
050 *   <li>Handles nested objects with proper field mapping
051 * </ul>
052 *
053 * <h2>Usage Example</h2>
054 *
055 * <pre>
056 * WeatherData weather = sdk.getWeather("London");
057 *
058 * // Access temperature
059 * double temp = weather.getTemperature().getTemp(); // in Kelvin
060 * double feelsLike = weather.getTemperature().getFeelsLike();
061 *
062 * // Access weather conditions
063 * String main = weather.getWeather().getMain(); // "Clear", "Rain", etc.
064 * String description = weather.getWeather().getDescription(); // "clear sky"
065 *
066 * // Access wind data
067 * double windSpeed = weather.getWind().getSpeed(); // in m/s
068 *
069 * // Access system data (sunrise/sunset)
070 * long sunrise = weather.getSystemInfo().getSunrise(); // Unix timestamp
071 *
072 * // Location information
073 * String cityName = weather.getName(); // "London"
074 * int timezone = weather.getTimezone(); // Offset from UTC in seconds
075 * </pre>
076 *
077 * @since 1.0.0
078 * @see com.weather.sdk.WeatherSDK#getWeather(String)
079 */
080@JsonIgnoreProperties(ignoreUnknown = true)
081public final class WeatherData {
082
083  /** The weather conditions list (main, description). */
084  @JsonProperty("weather")
085  private final List<Weather> weatherList;
086
087  /** The temperature data (current, feels-like). */
088  @JsonProperty("main")
089  private final Temperature temperature;
090
091  /** The visibility distance in meters. */
092  @JsonProperty("visibility")
093  private final int visibility;
094
095  /** The wind data (speed, direction). */
096  @JsonProperty("wind")
097  private final Wind wind;
098
099  /** The timestamp of the weather data in Unix epoch seconds. */
100  @JsonProperty("dt")
101  private final long datetime;
102
103  /** The system information (sunrise, sunset). */
104  @JsonProperty("sys")
105  private final SystemInfo systemInfo;
106
107  /** The timezone offset from UTC in seconds. */
108  @JsonProperty("timezone")
109  private final int timezone;
110
111  /** The name of the location. */
112  @JsonProperty("name")
113  private final String name;
114
115  /**
116   * Constructs a new WeatherData instance with all required fields.
117   *
118   * <p><strong>Note:</strong> This constructor is primarily intended for Jackson JSON
119   * deserialization. For normal usage, instances are created through the OpenWeatherAPI client and
120   * automatically mapped from JSON responses.
121   *
122   * @param weatherList the weather conditions list (main, description). Must not be null or empty.
123   * @param temperature the temperature data (current, feels-like). Must not be null.
124   * @param visibility the visibility distance in meters. Must be non-negative.
125   * @param wind the wind data (speed, direction). Must not be null.
126   * @param datetime the timestamp of the weather data in Unix epoch seconds. Must be non-negative.
127   * @param systemInfo the system information (sunrise, sunset). Must not be null.
128   * @param timezone the timezone offset from UTC in seconds. Can be positive or negative.
129   * @param name the name of the location. Must not be null or empty.
130   * @throws NullPointerException if any required parameter is null
131   * @throws IllegalArgumentException if visibility or datetime are negative
132   */
133  @JsonCreator
134  public WeatherData(
135      @JsonProperty("weather") final List<Weather> weatherList,
136      @JsonProperty("main") final Temperature temperature,
137      @JsonProperty("visibility") final int visibility,
138      @JsonProperty("wind") final Wind wind,
139      @JsonProperty("dt") final long datetime,
140      @JsonProperty("sys") final SystemInfo systemInfo,
141      @JsonProperty("timezone") final int timezone,
142      @JsonProperty("name") final String name) {
143    this.weatherList = Objects.requireNonNull(weatherList, "Weather information must not be null");
144    this.temperature =
145        Objects.requireNonNull(temperature, "Temperature information must not be null");
146    this.wind = Objects.requireNonNull(wind, "Wind information must not be null");
147    this.systemInfo = Objects.requireNonNull(systemInfo, "System information must not be null");
148    this.name = Objects.requireNonNull(name, "Location name must not be null");
149
150    if (visibility < 0) {
151      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Visibility must be non-negative, was: " + visibility);
152    }
153    if (datetime < 0) {
154      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Datetime must be non-negative, was: " + datetime);
155    }
156
157    this.visibility = visibility;
158    this.datetime = datetime;
159    this.timezone = timezone;
160  }
161
162  /**
163   * Returns the current weather conditions.
164   *
165   * @return the weather conditions. Never returns null.
166   */
167  public Weather getWeather() {
168    return weatherList.isEmpty() ? null : weatherList.get(0);
169  }
170
171  /**
172   * Returns the temperature data including current temperature and feels-like temperature.
173   *
174   * @return the temperature information. Never returns null.
175   */
176  public Temperature getTemperature() {
177    return temperature;
178  }
179
180  /**
181   * Returns the visibility distance.
182   *
183   * @return the visibility in meters. Always non-negative.
184   */
185  public int getVisibility() {
186    return visibility;
187  }
188
189  /**
190   * Returns the wind data including speed and direction.
191   *
192   * @return the wind information. Never returns null.
193   */
194  public Wind getWind() {
195    return new Wind(wind.getSpeed(), wind.getDirection());
196  }
197
198  /**
199   * Returns the timestamp when this weather data was recorded.
200   *
201   * @return the timestamp in Unix epoch seconds. Always non-negative.
202   */
203  public long getDatetime() {
204    return datetime;
205  }
206
207  /**
208   * Returns the system information including sunrise and sunset times.
209   *
210   * @return the system information. Never returns null.
211   */
212  public SystemInfo getSystemInfo() {
213    return new SystemInfo(systemInfo.getSunrise(), systemInfo.getSunset());
214  }
215
216  /**
217   * Returns the timezone offset from UTC.
218   *
219   * @return the timezone offset in seconds. Can be positive or negative.
220   */
221  public int getTimezone() {
222    return timezone;
223  }
224
225  /**
226   * Returns the name of the location.
227   *
228   * @return the location name. Never returns null or empty.
229   */
230  public String getName() {
231    return name;
232  }
233
234  /**
235   * Converts the Unix timestamp to Java timestamp (milliseconds).
236   *
237   * @return the timestamp in Java epoch milliseconds.
238   */
239  public long getTimestampMillis() {
240    return datetime * 1000L;
241  }
242
243  /**
244   * Indicates whether the data is recent (within the last hour).
245   *
246   * <p>This is a convenience method for checking if the weather data is considered current based on
247   * the data timestamp.
248   *
249   * @return true if the data is from the last hour, false otherwise
250   */
251  public boolean isRecent() {
252    final long oneHourAgo = System.currentTimeMillis() / 1000L - 3600L;
253    return datetime >= oneHourAgo;
254  }
255
256  /**
257   * Converts the temperature from Kelvin to Celsius.
258   *
259   * @return the temperature in Celsius
260   */
261  public double getTemperatureCelsius() {
262    return temperature.getTemp() - 273.15;
263  }
264
265  /**
266   * Converts the temperature from Kelvin to Fahrenheit.
267   *
268   * @return the temperature in Fahrenheit
269   */
270  public double getTemperatureFahrenheit() {
271    return (temperature.getTemp() - 273.15) * 9 / 5 + 32;
272  }
273
274  /**
275   * Converts the visibility from meters to kilometers.
276   *
277   * @return the visibility in kilometers
278   */
279  public double getVisibilityKm() {
280    return visibility / 1000.0;
281  }
282
283  /**
284   * Converts the visibility from meters to miles.
285   *
286   * @return the visibility in miles
287   */
288  public double getVisibilityMiles() {
289    return visibility / 1609.344;
290  }
291
292  @Override
293  public boolean equals(final Object obj) {
294    final boolean result;
295    if (this == obj) {
296      result = true;
297    } else if (obj == null || getClass() != obj.getClass()) {
298      result = false;
299    } else {
300      final WeatherData that = (WeatherData) obj;
301      result =
302          visibility == that.visibility
303              && datetime == that.datetime
304              && timezone == that.timezone
305              && Objects.equals(weatherList, that.weatherList)
306              && Objects.equals(temperature, that.temperature)
307              && Objects.equals(wind, that.wind)
308              && Objects.equals(systemInfo, that.systemInfo)
309              && Objects.equals(name, that.name);
310    }
311    return result;
312  }
313
314  @Override
315  public int hashCode() {
316    return Objects.hash(
317        weatherList, temperature, visibility, wind, datetime, systemInfo, timezone, name);
318  }
319
320  @Override
321  public String toString() {
322    return String.format(
323        "WeatherData{city='%s', weather='%s', temp=%.1fK, visibility=%dm, timezone=%d}",
324        name,
325        getWeather() != null ? getWeather().getMain() : "N/A",
326        temperature.getTemp(),
327        visibility,
328        timezone);
329  }
330}
